definition: to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting etc)
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
to imitate/to copy

sentences.english: The desks were littered with fruits which the students had been sketching.
sentences.chinese: 课桌上散乱地放着学生们正在临摹的水果。

sentences.english: I have occasionally taught a course in which students copy paintings in the museum.
sentences.chinese: 我教过一门课专门让学生临摹展馆里的绘画。

sentences.english: His painting is an exact copy of the original.
sentences.chinese: 他的画是与原作丝毫不差的临摹作品。

sentences.english: In a moment, we'll see how well he copies this inscription.
sentences.chinese: 一会儿呢我们就要去看看他到底临摹得怎么样了。

sentences.english: Interested in painting, Pan began by copying illustrations from popular novels.
sentences.chinese: 潘天寿对绘画很感兴趣，开始临摹知名小说中的插图。

sentences.english: The calm when the blue-black couplet letting a person like ink remembers copy calligraphy and unruffled .
sentences.chinese: 墨水般的深蓝色让人联想起临摹书法时的平静和安详。

sentences.english: Copying the ancients, ink pen with him to learn, to understand the idea of his pains.
sentences.chinese: 临摹古人，要学他用笔用墨，懂得他苦心构思。

sentences.english: The model posed herself for the art students.
sentences.chinese: 模特儿摆好了姿势让美术专业的学生临摹。

sentences.english: In fact good artists do not only copy life. They do far more than that.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，优秀的艺术家搞创作远不只单纯地临摹生活。

sentences.english: He had been copy the drawing of an antique coin.
sentences.chinese: 他正在临摹一枚古币的图样。

sentences.english: This was painted after an ancient picture.
sentences.chinese: 这是照一幅古画临摹的。

sentences.english: He practiced writing original forms of characters from a copybook of calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 书法时临摹的字帖都是繁体。

sentences.english: Clear, that is, to identify the name of the ancient paintings to a daily copy.
sentences.chinese: 明确之后，即找出有关的古名书画，使其每日临摹。

sentences.english: Eland has recreated famous artwork such as the Mona Lisa using just coffee.
sentences.chinese: 伊兰用咖啡临摹绘制了《蒙娜丽莎》这样的名画。

sentences.english: His painting is a/an exact copy of the original.
sentences.chinese: 他的画是与原作丝毫不差的临摹作品。

definition: to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting)
to practice calligraphy from a model
copybook (for calligraphy)
piece of paper with short note/short letter
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
to trace over/to copy (a calligraphy model)/facsimile/(fig.) to depict/to portray
gongbi, traditional Chinese painting method characterized by meticulous brush technique and detailed description
drawing/painting
sketch
authentic (painting or calligraphy)/genuine work (of famous artist)
a rubbing from a stone inscription
to paint
rough sketch (of a painting)/(of an official) to approve a document by signing it
painting/picture
freehand drawing or painting in traditional Chinese style
running script/semicursive script (Chinese calligraphic style)
technique of writing/calligraphy/or drawing
